thread.title: I’m A Celebrity Australia 2017: Julia Morris and Chris Brown’s x-rated gag
thread.title_full: I’m A Celebrity Australia 2017: Julia Morris and Chris Brown’s x-rated gag

title: I’m A Celebrity Australia 2017: Julia Morris and Chris Brown’s x-rated gag
text:
Share on Twitter 
THEY’VE always been fond of a cheeky double entendre, but I’m A Celeb hosts Chris Brown and Julia Morris really pushed the envelope in tonight’s episode of the show. 
Opening the program at 7pm, the lively pair slipped in a rather blue joke that no doubt went over the heads of many viewers. 
Reminiscing on the celebs’ first days in the camp, Morris reflected that they’d been “so full of beans” when they started on the show. 
“Technically, they are actually still full of beans. In fact, they are more full of beans than they have ever been,” she said, referring to the camp’s monotonous diet. 
“They do eat a lot of beans. But I imagine the celebrity who leaves tonight will be giving their beans the flick the moment they’re out of camp?” asked Brown. Chris and Julia, we know what you’re doing and you need to see us after class. Picture: Supplied/Nigel Wright for Ten. Source: Supplied 
“Mmm, that’s TOTALLY what I would do, doctor, ”said Morris, who at first seamlessly segued back into hosting, before admitting she was on “the verge of giggling.” 
If that entire exchange went over your head, we may have to give you quick a lesson in crude Australian slang — in the most delicate way (this is a family website, after all). 
‘Flicking the bean’ is a particularly euphemistic way of describing, ahem, female self-pleasuring. With cameras around 24/7, we’d imagine it’s one of many private joys denied to the celebs during their time in the jungle. 
The pair’s naughty little quip didn’t go entirely unnoticed: Did @drchrisbrown just joke about flicking the bean on #ImACelebrityAU or do I have heat stroke?
